required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multivitamin Dosage Regimens in the Prevention of Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes Among HIV-Positive Women
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Multivitamin Dosage Regimens in the Prevention of Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes Among HIV-Positive Women From Tanzania

collaborator.agency: Muhimbili University of Health and Allied Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine effects of daily administration of multivitamin supplements at doses resembling the Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) during pregnancy to HIV positive women decreases the risks of low birth weight (<2500 g), and pre-term birth (< 37 weeks gestation), compared to multivitamin supplements at doses above the RDA.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized clinical trial conducted to examine effects of daily administration of multivitamin supplements at doses resembling the Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) during pregnancy to HIV positive women decreases the risks of low birth weight (<2500 g), and pre-term birth (< 37 weeks gestation), compared to multivitamin supplements at doses above the RDA. All women receive standard prenatal care, including nevirapine for the prevention of mother-to-child transmission of HIV.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Monthly until the 32nd week of pregnancy, once every 2 weeks from 32nd to 36th week

arm_group.description: Multivitamins at doses resembling a single daily Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA)
Multivitamin supplements at multiples of the Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA)

intervention.description: 20 mg B1, 20 mg B2, 25 mg B6, 50 mcg B12, 100 mg niacin, 500 mg C, 30 mg E, 0.8 mg folic acid taken orally once per day until 6 weeks after delivery
1.4 mg B1, 1.4 mg B2, 1.9 mg B6, 50 mcg B12, 100 mg niacin, 70 mg C, 10 mg E, and 0.4 mg folic acid taken orally once per day until 6 weeks after delivery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV-positive pregnant women who are between 12 and 27 weeks gestation who intend to stay in Dar es Salaam until delivery.

results_reference.citation: Kawai K, Kupka R, Mugusi F, Aboud S, Okuma J, Villamor E, Spiegelman D, Fawzi WW. A randomized trial to determine the optimal dosage of multivitamin supplements to reduce adverse pregnancy outcomes among HIV-infected women in Tanzania. Am J Clin Nutr. 2010 Feb;91(2):391-7. doi: 10.3945/ajcn.2009.28483. Epub 2009 Nov 25.
